_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: All Other Chemical Product and Preparation Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Policy:
Advanced Aerosol Technologies is committed to provide a safe, healthy environment for our workers and for our community by insuring all regulatory guidelines are followed.

Listed below are the operating principles we adhere to;
a) Comply with all applicable safety, health, and environmental laws and directives.
b) Continually strive to reduce workplace injuries, incidents with the potential to cause property damge, material loss or interuption of our business, waste, and all releases to the environment.
c) Constantly stress the importanceof safe and environmentally responsible handling of our products, to our transporters, distributors, and our customers, to include the proper disposal of the empty containers.

Facility Description
On the Advanced Arosol technologies Corporate location in Seaford, De, we fill aerosol cans with a broad spectrum of specialty products. Flammable propellants, including propane, butane and methyl ether (DME), are used to pressurize  a majority of our product containers. All propellants are stored within the four (4) tanks located in our tank farm. Each tank is limited to 85% of capacity by administrative controls. The largest of the tankls has a twelve thousand (12,000) gallon capacity . (10,200 when de-rated to the 85% capacity level) The remaining tanks range from eighteen hundred (1,800) to five thousand (5,000) gallons nominal capacity. Propellants arepumped from the tank farm to a specially desgned Gas House where the aerosol cans are pressurized. Subsequently, the cans are mechanically conveyored into the plant from the Gas House for testing, inspection, packaging and shipment.

Worst Case Scenario :
Our worst case would be the release of the contents of our largest tank. If the tank contained n-butane, forty nine thousand five hundred (49,500) pounds of flammable propellant would be released into the environment. This occurance would have an off-site impact, based upon the use of EPA RMP* Comp program.

Alternative Case S

cenario:
This case assumes that simultaneously the internal excess flow valve on one (1) of the tanks within the tank farm malfunctions and the cover of the transfer pump develops a leak while in operation. We calculate that the leak would be detected and corrected within ten (10) minutes. This malfunction would result in the release of nine hundred (900) pounds into the environment and cause an off-site impact extending outward 0.08 miles (420 feet) as calculated by  the use of EPA RMP* Comp program.

Accident Prevention Program:
The use of flammable propellants in our facility, has been subject to the Delaware Extremely Hazardous Substanve Risk Management Act (EHSRMA) and the OSHA Process Safety Management standard (29CFR 1910.119) since operations commenced in 1994. The facility has a reviewed and updated risk management system in place to meet these requirements and to minimize the potential for accidental release of thease substances . Our management system includes:
Process hazard analysis to identify and correct potential hazards
Management of change procedures to assure that standards are maintained and potentiial new hazards are identified and evaluated.
Mechanical integrity procedures designed to determine MTBF (mean time between failures) of equipment to minimize mechanical issues.
Detailed operating procedures for process control.
Training for personnel involved in operating and maintaining the processes.
Facility design allows for multiple layers of incident prevention.

Five (5) Year Accident History
During the past five (5) years, this facility has not had any accidental releases of dflammable substances thatresulted in on-site injuries or damge and no off-site impacts.

Emergency Response Program
Advanced Aerosol Technologies, Inc has a written emergency response plan wihich has been updated and reviewed with the last month. It has been coordinated with the Sussex County Emergency Planning Committee (L.E.P.C.) and the Seaford Fire Department. Key per
sonnel at our facility have been trained using the new procedure and guidelines are in place to regularly retrain all employees.
